fieldset.name: Pseudo Absences
fieldset.label: Pseudo Absence Configuration
fieldset.description: Select and configure your strategy. Read More ...

field.name: pa_ratio
field.description: ratio of absence to presence points
field.title: absence-presence ratio

field.name: pa_strategy
field.description: strategy to generate pseudo-absence points: random; SRE (in sites with contrasting conditions to presences); disk (within a minimum and maximum distance from presences)
field.title: pseudo-absence strategy

field.name: pa_sre_quant
field.description: quantile used for 'SRE' pseudo-absence generation strategy; default is 0.025
field.title: pseudo-absence SRE quantile

field.name: pa_disk_min
field.description: minimum distance to presences for 'disk' pseudo-absence generation strategy
field.title: pseudo-absence disk minimum distance

field.name: pa_disk_max
field.description: maximum distance to presences for 'disk' pseudo-absence generation strategy
field.title: pseudo-absence disk maximum distance

fieldset.name: Other
fieldset.label: Other Configuration
fieldset.description: Options are set to package defaults unless otherwise modified.

field.name: tree_complexity
field.description: number of interactions between predictor variables that need to be considered; value of 1 will fit an additive model, value = 2 will include 2-way interactions, etc.
field.title: tree complexity

field.name: learning_rate
field.description: determines the contribution of each tree to the growing model
field.title: learning rate

field.name: bag_fraction
field.description: fraction of the data that is randomly selected to built the next tree in the model
field.title: bag fraction

field.name: n_folds
field.description: number of subsets used for cross-validation
field.title: number of cross validations (n folds)

field.name: prev_stratify
field.description: whether subsets should be selected in such a way that the mean response value is approximately equal in all subsets
field.title: prevalence stratify

field.name: family
field.description: distribution of the response variable; default is bernoulli, which is used for binary data
field.title: family

field.name: n_trees
field.description: number of initial trees to fit, and to add each cycle
field.title: number of trees added each cycle

field.name: max_trees
field.description: maximum number of trees to fit before stopping
field.title: maximum number of trees

field.name: tolerance_method
field.description: method used in deciding to stop: for ‘fixed’ the value indicated in ‘tolerance value’ is used; for ‘auto’ the value is ‘tolerance value * total mean deviance’
field.title: tolerance method
